Comment: >“People spend their whole careers [in the civil rights division] doing one particular kind of litigation, suing the police, suing the police, suing some more, suing employers, and it’s their part of it is a personal passion — well, this isn’t the personal passion department.”  It's honestly... infuriating. The sheer audacity to treat civil rights like some kind of optional extra, a hobby to be sidelined when it inconveniences those in power... it's just beyond comprehension. And the casual dismissal, “this isn't the personal passion department”, shows how little regard they have for the very people who deserve protection! The beneficiaries of this shocking shift are those who want to silence dissent and maintain control, and it's such a betrayal of our nation's values. I can't shake this feeling that it's all part of a larger plan... a plan that allows them to get away with it. Really unacceptable.
